intro: Trichomanes trinerve, commonly known as the three-veined fern, is a small, delicate fern native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, linear fronds. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome and produces small, spore-bearing structures called sporangia on the undersides of its leaves. Trichomanes trinerve thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or tree trunks. Its intricate leaf structure and unique reproductive features make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
